Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2014 05:29PM atlbc wrote: I am 12 days out from 1st TCH.  I do not have a port.  The hand used for the infusion has a red rash on the back side going up my arm.  My chemo nurse says that it is taxotere burn.  Has anyone experienced this?  Looks like I am getting a port after all.

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2014 04:04PM atlbc wrote: Sammie- I had my first TCH on 1/27.  I used Claritin the day before Neulasta, the day of and 5 days after.  I had a few aches in my lower back and that was all.  I used Target's generic for Claritin.

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2014 05:44AM atlbc wrote: Warrior Woman...  I am getting 6 TCH, 3 weeks apart and Herceptin for a year.  My 1st chemo was Monday 1/27 using an IV. My hand and arm was sore, similar to a mild carpal tunnel feeling during the Taxotere and the Carboplatin.  I am hoping to make it without a port. I had my Neulasta yesterday.  So far no SE.
